Description: Rim and wall sherd (mended from two fragments) of East Greek pottery plate; orange-pink clay with much silver mica and grey core; exterior, and underside of stand-ring glazed; underside of floor reserved; interior, cream slip: chequerboard on rim; black band with superimposed red band lined in white at edge of floor; perhaps maeander band inside.
Curator's comments: Very likely to be from same plate as 1888,0601.559b-d.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.789)
